snippet: Tens of thousands of Namibians were killed in what historians call the 20th century’s first genocide, and Germany is finally close to recognizing it as such....
abstract: 'German government prepares to recognize as genocide country's crimes against African tribes in its former colony Namibia, where monuments to German soldiers still outnumber those of natives;' negotiates plan to compensate and apologize for campaign carried out between 1904 and 1908, which prefigured Nazi techniques and Holocaust.
lead_paragraph: Tens of thousands of Namibians were killed in what historians call the 20th century’s first genocide, and Germany is finally close to recognizing it as such.

headline.main: Germany Grapples With Its African Genocide
headline.print_headline: Germany Confronts Its Genocide Past in Africa

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
